intro: Unona montana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Unona montana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shady, moist forest environments.
